overview_summary: One adjacent landowner is an affiliate of a major industrial developer (NorthPoint Development) that has speculatively acquired and developed a large tract in the area. This suggests a sophisticated player with resources and influence—potentially a competitor for land use, but also a possible partner if the new project aligns with their industrial expansion plans.

neighbors.name: NP Highridge Park LLC
neighbors.claims: NP Highridge Park LLC is an affiliate of NorthPoint Development (a Kansas City, MO industrial real estate firm) formed to purchase an approximately 52-acre unimproved parcel (Lot 10 of Highridge Industrial Park) from Prologis for $2.235 million in December 2015 [Republican Herald](https://republicanherald4.rssing.com/chan-15221936/article10455.html). NorthPoint concurrently acquired a neighboring 37.5-acre tract and constructed a ~357,500 sq ft speculative warehouse (no tenant at the time), combining the two parcels into a total 89-acre industrial development site ([republicanherald4.rssing.com](https://republicanherald4.rssing.com/chan-15221936/article10455.html#:~:text=%E2%80%9CThey%E2%80%99re%20building%20on%20speculation,at%20this%20point%2C%E2%80%9D%20Zukas%20said))[Schuylkill EDC](https://www.sed-co.com/Buildings/). A NorthPoint representative contributed at least $4,500 in 2022 to Pennsylvania State Senator David Argall, indicating the company’s effort to build political goodwill locally [OpenSecrets](https://www.opensecrets.org/donor-lookup/results?cycle=2022&order=desc&page=1&sort=N&zip=18707).
neighbors.influence_justification: Owns ~89 acres of industrial land locally; demonstrated political engagement via donations; capable of attracting large projects but not a longstanding community entity

approach_recommendations.engage: Contact NorthPoint’s development executive (e.g., Brent Miles) directly to discuss the project and address any land-use concerns; emphasize that the new development will not impede their industrial plans and may offer shared benefits (e.g., infrastructure improvements, buffer zones).
